description: {"blocks":[{"key":"crvj4","text":"The following protocol describes how to make Ca2+ sensitive electrodes to measure extracellular Ca2+ concentrations at high spatiotemporal resolution in acute ex vivo brain slices. Glass micropipettes can be precisely (µm precision) located at/near a particular brain region/cell type of interest to measure rapid changes in Ca2+ concentrations.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":47,"length":2},{"style":"sup","offset":98,"length":2},{"style":"sup","offset":327,"length":2},{"style":"italic","offset":159,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2hmoj","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3rpsd","text":"In our experience, manifacturing electrodes fresh on the day gave the optimal results, and disposing of the electrodes after one day. Re-usage of the same electrode within a single day for several recordings provided reliable results.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

GC150F-10; 1.5 OD x 0.86 IK x 100 L mm; Harvard Apparatus)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bf0md","text":"Heat-resistant glass jar (~7-10 ml) with screw-on lid","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ffa98","text":"Electrophysiological set-up with amplifier to perform recordings","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8e8dd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"206g8","text":"Reagents:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e1ioj","text":"Calcium ionophore I cocktail A (Sigma-Aldrich, St Louis, Missouri, USA)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dkl1k","text":"Dimethyldichlorosilane (40136 selectophore, FLUKA)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"783l2","text":"aCSF with increasing Ca2+ concentrations (0.1 mM - 2 mM) to validate electrodes","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":23,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1uaft","text":"CaCl2 2M for backfilling","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":4,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ektcs","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7d9cc","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bst33","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"safety","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":347,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"7p426","text":"Dimethyldichlorosilane is a dangerous chemical that must be handled with extreme care. Wear gloves, goggles, a mask and a lab coat. The next steps should be performed in a fume hood which must be in proper working order with the sash closed as far as possible.  Remnant dimethyldichlorosilane must be carefully disposed of as per local guidelines.","type":"align-justify"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"53kpo","text":"Electrodes should be calibrated at experimental temperatures (~33°C) with standard aCSF solutions containing increasing concentrations of Ca2+ (0, 0.1, 0.2, 0.4, 0.8, 1.2, 1.6 and 2 mM), the potentials for each concentration recorded, and a calibration curve obtained fitted with a logarithmic function.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":140,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bh6q1","text":"Optional: Comparison experiments to examine sensitivity for other ionic solutions (Zn2+, Mg2+, K+) can be performed in aCSF with or without 1.6 mM Ca2+ present.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10},{"style":"sup","offset":85,"length":2},{"style":"sup","offset":91,"length":2},{"style":"sup","offset":149,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1sbdl","text":"Only electrodes exhibiting a potential jump exceeding 20 mV between concentrations 0.2 and 2 mM (‘sensitivity’) for Ca2+ should be used for experiments.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":118,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dsc5f","text":"Pull glass capillaries on the horizontal puller to get a sharp tip, with opening ~1-2 µm and roughly a ~3-5 MOhm resistance.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dnco5","text":"Optional: Break electrode tips under a microscope by gently pushing them against a clean glass rod to reach the intended diameter.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7fnlr","text":"Store the pipettes upright in the top cap of one of the pre-drilled glass containers until the next step.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"46nrt","text":"Preheat the oven in the fume hood to 120°C. Make sure everything is clean and ready to go.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"39eqq","text":"Pour approx. ~5-10 ml undiluted dimethyldichlorosilane into the bottom glass vial to fill it approximately half-way.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7k33g","text":"Carefully place the cap with the inserted pipettes onto the bottom glass vial and close the vial.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fu8e8","text":"Expose the pipettes to the dimethyldichlorosilane vapor for ~50 seconds.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c88bs","text":"Place the cap with the pipettes (without the glass bottle) in the preheated oven and bake for 2 hours at 120°C.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"76av9","text":"After 2 hours, take the cap out of the oven and place the cap in the hood to cool down. The oven can be turned off.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9dm1b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bklgp","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7t1ol","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"safety","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":48,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"9g5um","text":"Use gloves when handling the silanized pipettes.","type":"align-justify"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5m6sn","text":"Place a long 20 µl pipette tip on a p20 pipette.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"82crc","text":"Fill the pipette tip with ~1-2 µl of calcium ionophore cocktail A. Calcium ionophore cocktail A should be prevented from extensive light exposure.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dk3pd","text":"Carefully backfill the cocktail to the outmost tip of the silanized glass pipettes (~1 µl per pipette). See main image for example.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8no4j","text":"Carefully check the tip and filling under the coarse light microscope. Discard badly filled pipettes or carefully attempt to remove the bubbles. The ionophore must be clean and homogenous.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b66e","text":"If correct, carefully fill the rest of the pipette with CaCl2 (2 M).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":60,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b6c3e","text":"Leave the electrodes to rest for at least ~30 mins before any next steps.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dba73","text":"Optional: Further sensitivity can be tested in situ by applying either a calcium chelator (eg. EGTA, BAPTA) or high applying Ca2+ concentrations (eg. 20 mM).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
